text:
I would really love to have an Update option in HubDB that let's you import a CSV and have it update rows by ID.

Right now, it's looking like I'll have to build this myself with the API, but I'm fairly certain this must be a common pain point when you want to update a lot of data in bulk on large tables.

Exporting and Replacing doesn't cut it for me since I reference the Row ID's from another table's Foreign ID column. Replacing changes the Row ID and breaks the connection.
If on the CSV you have the hs_id column they'll replace the values of that row instead of replacing every row and resetting the ids

Sorry, but that's the line I get from Support.

It's just not the case. Before : After.

I can confirm <@U01E105CPC3> is correct.
I’m pretty sure hubdb development has taken a backseat to custom objects. So I don’t expect this to change any time soon
I wonder if the hs_id thing is just broken then? Support keep telling me it's possible, but I've never seen it work myself. Not all of you can be wrong, right? :sweat_smile:
Strange, I do it almost weekly without any problem, are you using the same file you get from "Export -> CSV"?
No, because that CSV is always corrupted! I used the XLS and convert.
dang, maybe we ain’t holdin’ our mouth right <@U01E105CPC3>

<@U01E105CPC3> if the input csv file has `hs_id`  column with the correct row ids and if you select `Replace`  option in the UI, it updates the existing rows without creating new rows every time.. I just tested in UI and it works..
So you input CSV file does not have hs_id column at all?
